attributes.action: Increase the national speed limits on motorways to 100 mph
attributes.additional_details:
Hammond, May, and Clarkson have tested the outdated Highway Code on stopping distance as a justification for the impractical 70mph speed limit. They found that most cars have that safe and effective stopping power at 113 mph. 78.9% of Britons surveyed on DriveTube also agree the speed limit's too slow.

What is the point of having a fifth gear on a car? By travelling at 100mph, fuel consumption will be maximised, fewer emission will be emitted & journey times will be shortened!

Win-win!
attributes.background:
70 mph on motorways are too slow. In Germany, they have no speed limits whatsoever on the Autobahn.
The Highway Code here in the UK states that a car need 240 feet to stop from travelling at 60 mph in order to be considered safe.

Most cars have that safe and effective stopping power at 113 mph.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/322271
